{include "default_salutation"} –

In the aftermath of George Floyd's murder by Minneapolis police, people all over the country are coming together to secure a future where the Constitution guarantees rights to all people, and where our core institutions are guided by the principles of justice and equity, rather than by racism and xenophobia.

People just like you are responding to this challenge with courage, strength, and resilience. Will you join us this Thursday, July 16, at 4:30 p.m. CT to hear their inspiring stories?

2020 ACLU-MN Liberty Awards

Be inspired by ordinary people doing extraordinary things in the fight for equity and justice in Minnesota.

Thursday, July 16, 4:30 p.m.
Streaming Live on Facebook and YouTube

RSVP Today


We have an opportunity to fundamentally change the racist, violent status quo in policing, and we are working hard to stay energized for the fight to come.

That's why we're inviting you to tune in this week to The ACLU-MN Liberty Awards. The Liberty Awards will feature remarks from heroes in the fight for equity and justice in Minnesota, including Valerie Castile, whose son Philando was killed by police in 2016, and who subsequently founded the Philando Castile Relief Foundation and became a vocal and respected advocate for policing reforms in our state.

The program will also feature Twin Cities immigration attorney Kim Hunter, the Nobles County Public Defenders Office, and police accountability activist Amy Koopman.

These heroes don't wear capes – they are everyday people, just like you, whose courage and conviction have driven them to do extraordinary things in their communities. As we prepare to take the next steps towards justice and equity in Minnesota and around the country, their messages of strength and resilience will inspire you to keep giving everything you have to this historic fight.

ACLU of {affiliate_name}
